content: I have a question about IG authoring. Does anyone think it would be unreasonable if I made a rule that the IG publisher does not support contained conformance resources?
Seems unreasonable to me, wouldn't one of the most useful resources to distribute with an IG be a formal description of the conformance for the IG?
um, I'm not sure what you mean. I specifically mean that I'm going to prohibit using DomainResource.contained
So you could still distribute conformance resources as part of the IG content, just not as part of the ImplementationGuide?
indeed yes, of course. that's the whole point
Contained value sets are reasonable in some cases I think. I'm not sure about other contained things.
I agree that contained value sets seem reasonable, but I don't know how to publish contained resources

I need some clarity. So we are not supporting .contained for example instances? Or as a profile constraint for conformance resources only. We need to support it for contained Medications for MedicationStatement and MedicationOrder. So since is a clinical resource that would be allowed.
For publishing do you mean creating the SD views for a contained thingy?
yes - conformance resource. other contained resources in examples are fine
